revised_title: Stabilizing the No-Motion State in the Rayleigh-Bénard Problem Using Feedback Control
tldr: The authors demonstrate that the no-motion state in the Rayleigh-Bénard problem can be significantly stabilized using a feedback controller. They propose two control strategies, one utilizing temperature sensors and thermal actuators, and the other using velocity sensors and actuators. Linear stability analysis shows that the critical Rayleigh number for the onset of convection can be increased with the aid of the controller, delaying the transition to motion.
